metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3345 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
_gcry_md_block_write in cipher/hash-common.c in Libgcrypt version 1.9.0 has a heap-based buffer overflow when the digest final function sets a large count value. It is recommended to upgrade to 1.9.1 or later.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.6').
